creator: Patrick.Debois@sos.be
text:
In the source file LDAPClient.java the dircontext is set to NULL as a way to
close the connection. This is not the correct way to close it.

dirContext.close(); should preceed dirContext=null.

Also note that a connection pool would be nice. Otherwise make an explicit LDAP
transaction (open with reuse connection option and close).
This would make it more general for real testing: when doing a real test the
test client now swaps the servers with connects but what if you want to test the
query speed.

creator: jsalvata@atg.com
text:
Checked the code. The LDAP connection is being closed.

Converting this to an enhancement request for a connection pool or LDAP transaction.

Summary was: LDAP Connection not closed correctly

The LDAP extended sampler has separate functions for bind and unbind so as far 
as I can tell this is no longer necessary.
